nutritional_support_vitality.title: General nutritional support
nutritional_support_vitality.description: Adequate intake of essential vitamins and minerals is often discussed as part of maintaining overall vitality.

information.text: Multivitamins are sometimes used to help cover potential nutritional gaps in the diet.

vitamin_d_status_awareness.title: Vitamin D status awareness
vitamin_d_status_awareness.description: Vitamin D levels can vary based on factors such as sun exposure, diet, and geographic location.

information.text: Vitamin D status is commonly assessed in clinical settings using blood-based measurements.

vitamin_d_intake.title: Vitamin D intake considerations
vitamin_d_intake.description: Vitamin D is available from sunlight, food sources, and dietary supplements.

information.text: Vitamin D3 is a commonly used supplemental form and has been widely studied.

vitamin_d_measurements.title: Understanding vitamin D measurements
vitamin_d_measurements.description: Healthcare professionals may evaluate vitamin D levels over time to understand trends and changes.

information.text: Different vitamin D ranges are used clinically to interpret laboratory results.

vitamin_mineral_balance.title: Vitamin and mineral balance
vitamin_mineral_balance.description: Vitamins and minerals play roles in many metabolic and immune-related processes.

information.text: Vitamin D is involved in immune regulation and metabolic pathways.

mitochondrial_nutrients_coq10.title: Mitochondrial nutrients
mitochondrial_nutrients_coq10.description: Certain nutrients are involved in mitochondrial processes related to cellular energy production.

information.text: CoQ10 participates in energy transfer within the mitochondria.

mitochondrial_nutrients_coq10.analyzePrompt: Analyze the image and determine mitochondrial support needs.

cellular_energy_nad.title: Cellular energy metabolism
cellular_energy_nad.description: Cellular energy production relies on complex metabolic pathways.

information.text: NAD+ is involved in cellular metabolism and DNA maintenance mechanisms.

sleep_timing_circadian.title: Sleep timing awareness
sleep_timing_circadian.description: Early bedtimes are commonly discussed in relation to circadian rhythm alignment.

information.text: Sleep timing has been studied in connection with melatonin cycles and recovery processes.

sleep_magnesium_hormonal.title: Hormonal support considerations
sleep_magnesium_hormonal.description: Magnesium is a mineral that has been studied in relation to relaxation and sleep.

information.text: Magnesium has been researched in connection with sleep quality and cortisol regulation.

calm_alertness_ltheanine.title: Calm alertness compounds
calm_alertness_ltheanine.description: L-Theanine is commonly found in green tea and has been studied for its effects on attention.

information.text: L-Theanine has been researched in relation to calm focus and reduced distraction.

neurotransmitter_ltyrosine.title: Neurotransmitter precursors
neurotransmitter_ltyrosine.description: L-Tyrosine is an amino acid that serves as a precursor to dopamine.

information.text: L-Tyrosine has been studied in relation to cognitive function during stressful conditions.

maintain_hydration.title: Maintain hydration
maintain_hydration.description: Consistent daily hydration supports circulation, temperature regulation, and immune resilience.

information.text: Hydration status can influence immune function, recovery, and overall well-being.

vitamin_c_immunity.title: Vitamin C overview
vitamin_c_immunity.description: Vitamin C is a water-soluble vitamin found in fruits and vegetables.

information.text: Vitamin C is an antioxidant that has been studied in relation to immune cell function.

echinacea_herbs.title: Traditional herbal compounds
echinacea_herbs.description: Echinacea is an herb that has been traditionally used and studied in relation to immune health.

information.text: Echinacea has been researched for its potential effects on cold duration and immune resilience.

calming_glycine.title: Calming amino acids
calming_glycine.description: Glycine is an amino acid that functions as a neurotransmitter in the central nervous system.

information.text: Glycine has been studied for its potential calming effects and influence on sleep quality.

neuropeptide_semax.title: Neuropeptide research
neuropeptide_semax.description: Semax is a synthetic peptide that has been studied in neurological research contexts.

information.text: Semax has been researched for its potential effects on brain chemistry and cognitive function.

breathwork_parasympathetic.title: Breathwork practices
breathwork_parasympathetic.description: Practice daily breathwork (4-7-8 breathing, box breathing) to activate parasympathetic nervous system.

information.text: Controlled breathing techniques have been studied in relation to heart rate variability and stress reduction.

sleep_optimization_recovery.title: Sleep optimization
sleep_optimization_recovery.description: Prioritize 7-9 hours of quality sleep for nervous system recovery.

information.text: Sleep is essential for autonomic nervous system balance and restoration.

sunlight_circadian.title: Sunlight exposure
sunlight_circadian.description: Morning sunlight exposure regulates circadian rhythm and cortisol patterns.

information.text: Light exposure timing has been studied in relation to circadian rhythm entrainment.

cold_exposure_ans.title: Cold exposure
cold_exposure_ans.description: Cold exposure (showers, ice baths) trains ANS resilience and vagal tone.

information.text: Cold water immersion has been researched for its effects on sympathetic activation and adaptation.

meditation_mindfulness.title: Meditation and mindfulness
meditation_mindfulness.description: Meditation and mindfulness reduce sympathetic activation and improve HRV.

information.text: Mindfulness practices have been extensively studied in relation to stress reduction and autonomic regulation.

nature_parasympathetic.title: Nature exposure
nature_parasympathetic.description: Time in nature activates parasympathetic nervous system and reduces stress hormones.

information.text: Forest bathing and nature exposure have been studied for their calming physiological effects.

hrv_recovery_monitoring.title: Recovery monitoring
hrv_recovery_monitoring.description: Avoid overtraining - monitor HRV for recovery status before intense workouts.

information.text: HRV monitoring has been studied as a tool for optimizing training load and recovery.

social_connection_vagal.title: Social connection
social_connection_vagal.description: Social connection and laughter boost vagal tone and parasympathetic activity.

information.text: Social bonding has been researched in relation to vagus nerve activity and stress buffering.

calming_music_waves.title: Calming music
calming_music_waves.description: Listen to calming music or binaural beats to promote alpha wave activity.

information.text: Music therapy and binaural beats have been studied for their effects on brain wave patterns and relaxation.

adaptogenic_herbs.title: Adaptogenic herbs
adaptogenic_herbs.description: Adaptogenic herbs (ashwagandha, rhodiola) support ANS balance under stress.

information.text: Adaptogens have been researched for their potential to modulate stress response systems.

neuromuscular_training.title: Neuromuscular training concepts
neuromuscular_training.description: Protein intake and neuromuscular training have been studied in sports science.

information.text: Motor unit recruitment and neuromuscular efficiency are key concepts in strength and power development research.

creatine_atp_strength.title: Creatine
creatine_atp_strength.description: Creatine supports ATP production and physical performance.
creatine_atp_strength.warning: Creatine supplementation may affect kidney function in individuals with pre-existing conditions.

betaalanine_endurance.title: Endurance-related compounds
betaalanine_endurance.description: Beta-alanine is an amino acid that has been studied in relation to exercise performance.

information.text: Beta-alanine has been researched for its role in buffering hydrogen ions during high-intensity exercise.

shilajit_performance.title: Traditional performance compounds
shilajit_performance.description: Shilajit is a traditional substance containing minerals and fulvic acid.

information.text: Shilajit has been studied in some research contexts related to physical performance.

probiotics_microbiota.title: Gut microbiota overview
probiotics_microbiota.description: Probiotics are live microorganisms that have been studied in relation to gut health.

information.text: Probiotics have been researched for their potential effects on gut microbiota balance and immune function.

probiotics_microbiota.warning: Consult with a healthcare provider before starting probiotic supplementation if you have compromised immunity.

fiber_microbiome.title: Dietary fiber sources
fiber_microbiome.description: Research has identified various bacterial strains in the gut. A study from Zoe identified the strain SGB15249 in individuals who consumed nuts and seeds regularly.

information.text: Nuts and seeds are dietary sources of fiber that have been studied in relation to microbiome composition.

milk_thistle_liver.title: Hepatic support compounds
milk_thistle_liver.description: Milk Thistle is an herb that contains silymarin, which has been studied in liver research.

information.text: Milk Thistle has been researched for its potential role in liver cell function and regeneration.

hiit_vo2max.title: High-intensity interval training
hiit_vo2max.description: HIIT is a training method that has been extensively studied in exercise physiology.

information.text: HIIT has been researched for its effects on VOâ‚‚ max and metabolic adaptations.

hiit_vo2max.analyzePrompt: The user has a goal to perform at least 2 high-intensity interval training (HIIT) sessions per week. Based on the workout log, evaluate whether the goal was achieved. Summarize progress and give encouragement or advice.

running_volume_aerobic.title: Progressive volume training
running_volume_aerobic.description: Gradual increases in training volume are commonly discussed in running programs.

information.text: Progressive volume increases have been studied in relation to aerobic base development and injury prevention.

running_volume_aerobic.analyzePrompt: The user is working to increase total running distance each week. Given the workout data, analyze if there's an upward trend. Mention any signs of overtraining or progress plateaus.

multivitamin_general.title: Multivitamin
multivitamin_general.description: Essential vitamins and minerals support overall health and vitality.

coq10_mitochondrial.title: Coenzyme Q10
coq10_mitochondrial.description: CoQ10 supports mitochondrial energy production and cellular health.

nad_plus_energy.title: NAD+
nad_plus_energy.description: NAD+ is involved in cellular metabolism and energy pathways.

vitamin_d_support.title: Vitamin D
vitamin_d_support.description: Vitamin D supports immune function and metabolic health.

magnesium_relaxation.title: Magnesium
magnesium_relaxation.description: Magnesium supports relaxation, sleep quality, and nervous system function.

betaine_cardiovascular.title: Betaine
betaine_cardiovascular.description: Betaine supports cardiovascular function and physical performance.
